sentence.Network_en: I remember this extraordinary man with particular affection for his unfailing cheerfulness.
sentence.Network_cn: 我记得这个与众不同的人，他总是一幅乐呵呵的样子，让我特别有好感。

sentence.Network_en: She knew that her efforts to feign cheerfulness weren't convincing.
sentence.Network_cn: 她明白自己强作欢颜是瞒不了谁的.

sentence.Network_en: Cheerfulness is the best promoter of health.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 《综合英语二》整理资料[旺旺英语论坛] ... earnings 赚得的钱 cheerfulness 愉快 hesitation 犹豫.
听陈琦老师在耳边念答案 ... E. caveat:forbid 警告 : 禁止 A. cheerfulness 高兴 B. loveliness 可爱.
花语：轻快(cheerfulness) 你看小小的黄花成群绽放，树枝和叶片上的白色细毛随风摇曳，多麽轻快呀!令人感受到一股无比的轻松自在。
快乐(cheerfulness) 快乐与热情类似,需要尽力往事情好的一面看。有一个瓶子,里面装了一半水,热情快乐的人看到的是半瓶水,而忧郁悲观的人则只看到了瓶子的一半.

list.abs: C开头的单词_百度文库 ... cheek n. 面颊，脸蛋 cheer vt. 使振作；欢呼 cheerful a. 快乐的，愉快的.
喝字的解释---在线新华字典 ... 喝醉，喝醉酒〖 be(get)drunk〗 喝彩〖 acclaim;cheer〗 喝叱，喝斥〖 bawlout〗.
澳洲英语+澳洲俚语-网络中国翻译 ... I am pleased to meet you. 很高兴遇见你。 Cheers 干杯 Ankle Biter: 小孩，小不点儿.
Optimistic 乐观的Cheerful 开朗的Happy 开心的 Open 详细相关文档更多>> http://www.docin.com/p-588975672.html  http://www.docin.com/p-524958613.html.
大英语B级词汇表 - 豆丁网 ... cheer n./v. 欢呼 cheerful adj. 愉快的,高兴的 cheese n. 干酪.

entry.tran: 欢快的;高兴的;兴高采烈的
entry.def: Someone who is cheerful is happy and shows this in their behaviour.

example.ex: They are both very cheerful in spite of their colds...
example.tran: 他们俩虽然感冒了，可都兴高采烈的。

example.ex: Jack sounded quite cheerful about the idea.
example.tran: 杰克好像对这个想法很高兴。

entry.tran: 令人愉快的;令人开心的
entry.def: Something that is cheerful is pleasant and makes you feel happy.

example.ex: The nursery is bright and cheerful, with plenty of toys.
example.tran: 托儿所明亮宜人，还有许多玩具。

entry.tran: 乐观的;开朗的;满不在乎的
entry.def: If you describe someone's attitude as cheerful, you mean they are not worried about something, and you think that they should be.

example.ex: There is little evidence to support many of Mr Will's cheerful assumptions.
example.tran: 没有多少证据能支持威尔先生的那些乐观设想。

means.word_mean: 1. the quality of being cheerful and dispelling gloom;

sentences.sentence: "flowers added a note of cheerfulness to the drab room"

means.word_mean: 2. a feeling of spontaneous good spirits;

auth_sentence.content: He seemed to many a paragon of cheerfulness.
auth_sentence.res_content: He seemed to many a paragon of cheerfulness.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He seemed to many a paragon of cheerfulness.

auth_sentence.content: The general cheerfulness Perowne finds baffling.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The general cheerfulness Perowne finds baffling.

auth_sentence.content: The emperor of cheerfulness turned sarcastic.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The emperor of cheerfulness turned sarcastic.
